instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Any idea what this might be?
threads.message: Does anyone know what chip this is, its purpose or possibly the manufacturer? It's on a 2015 MacBook Pro Samsung SSD.

threads.title: Any idea what this might be?
threads.message: Need donor ssd. Fixing these is quite hopeless

threads.title: Any idea what this might be?
threads.message: Yeah, definitely agree with you, I've never brought one back, but this one feels extremely close. It will actually work in a 2014 model (slightly slow), but not a 2015. And it's a 512GB so I have a decent amount of motivation. I was about to pull a chip off a donor but even dead SSD's are a little too valuable to destroy so I'm trying to find the actual chip.
